results.title: The Effectiveness of Statins as Potential Therapy for Multiple Sclerosis: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled trials
results.text_hl: Summary of the statins use outcomes in @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@optic neuritis@@@: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ used in @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@optic neuritis@@@ showed significant benefits on the visual acuity, color perception, visual evoked potential (VEP) latency and VEP amplitude in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ arm compared to placebo.

citations.NLM: Abdalla MA, Zakhary CM, Rushdi H, Hamdan JA, Youssef KN, Khan A, Khan S. The Effectiveness of Statins as Potential Therapy for Multiple Sclerosis: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled trials Cureus. 2021 Sep;13(9):e18092. PMID: 34692306
citations.BibTeX: @article{34692306, title={The Effectiveness of Statins as Potential Therapy for Multiple Sclerosis: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled trials}, author={Abdalla MA and Zakhary CM and Rushdi H and Hamdan JA and Youssef KN and Khan A and Khan S}, journal={Cureus}, volume={13}, number={9}, pages={e18092}}

citations.NLM: Johnson MA, Cadavid D. Simvastatin in acute optic neuritis. Mult Scler. 2012 Nov;18(11):1657; author reply 1658. PMID: 22801929
citations.BibTeX: @article{22801929, title={Simvastatin in acute optic neuritis.}, author={Johnson MA and Cadavid D}, journal={Mult Scler}, volume={18}, number={11}, pages={1657; author reply 1658}}

results.title: [Immunomodulation and neuroprotection in optic neuritis].
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: According to the data from recent treatment trials, there is hope that @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal loss@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@ON@@@ can be reduced with the help of immunomodulatory substances, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or neuroprotective agents, such as @CHEMICAL_Memantine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008559 @@@memantine@@@ and @GENE_EPO @GENE_2056 @@@erythropoietin@@@.

citations.NLM: Beisse F, Diem R. [Immunomodulation and neuroprotection in optic neuritis]. Ophthalmologe. 2016 May;113(5):398-401. PMID: 27165274
citations.BibTeX: @article{27165274, title={[Immunomodulation and neuroprotection in optic neuritis].}, author={Beisse F and Diem R}, journal={Ophthalmologe}, volume={113}, number={5}, pages={398-401}}

results.title: Simvastatin improves final visual outcome in acute optic neuritis: a randomized study.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ improves final visual outcome in acute @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@optic neuritis@@@: a randomized study.

citations.NLM: Tsakiri A, Kallenbach K, Fuglø D, Wanscher B, Larsson H, Frederiksen J. Simvastatin improves final visual outcome in acute optic neuritis: a randomized study. Mult Scler. 2012 Jan;18(1):72-81. PMID: 21921071

results.title: Increased immunopotency of monocyte derived dendritic cells from patients with optic neuritis is inhibited in vitro by simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Increased immunopotency of monocyte derived dendritic cells from @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@optic neuritis@@@ is inhibited in vitro by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Tsakiri A, Tsiantoulas D, Frederiksen J, Svane IM. Increased immunopotency of monocyte derived dendritic cells from patients with optic neuritis is inhibited in vitro by simvastatin. Exp Neurol. 2010 Feb;221(2):320-8. PMID: 19948167

results.title: Optic neuritis as a phase 2 paradigm for neuroprotection therapies of multiple sclerosis: update on current trials and perspectives.
results.text_hl: RECENT FINDINGS: @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009902 @@@Optic neuritis@@@ has been used in a series of recent pilot studies investigating the effects of @GENE_EPO @GENE_2056 @@@erythropoietin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, autologous mesenchymal stem cells, @CHEMICAL_Phenytoin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010672 @@@phenytoin@@@, as well as blockade of @GENE_LINGO1 @GENE_84894 @@@LINGO-1@@@ (@CHEMICAL_opicinumab @CHEMICAL_MESH:C000625770 @@@opicinumab@@@).

citations.NLM: Aktas O, Albrecht P, Hartung HP. Optic neuritis as a phase 2 paradigm for neuroprotection therapies of multiple sclerosis: update on current trials and perspectives. Curr Opin Neurol. 2016 Jun;29(3):199-204. PMID: 27035900
citations.BibTeX: @article{27035900, title={Optic neuritis as a phase 2 paradigm for neuroprotection therapies of multiple sclerosis: update on current trials and perspectives.}, author={Aktas O and Albrecht P and Hartung HP}, journal={Curr Opin Neurol}, volume={29}, number={3}, pages={199-204}}
